title: Kasa
goal: This was the first React project with OpenClassrooms. The goal of the project was to get familiar with React using hooks and building re-usable components. As I was already familiar with React, it was a great opportunity to improve my skills in React.
description: The project was a Airbnb-like web application. I had to code the homepage, the house profile page and the about page. The homepage was built using a flexbox, as well as the house profile page. Using React made simpler the opening/closing of the accordeon boxes found in the about page and the house profile.

title: Oh my food!
goal: Get familiar with animations using CSS
description: The project consists on building an application for busy people who wants to order in a restaurant in advance: when they arrive at the restaurant, they can start eating without waiting. I tried to play around and have fun making interesting animations. The animation I struggled the most was the heart filling animation, partly due to the radiant backgroung.

title: Fisheye
description: I enjoyed making this project because I liked the design and I had to learn a lot about how to make an accessible website. Also, I had to push myself beyond my comfort zonw (compared to the previous projects I made), as I had to develop a sorting algorithm for the pictures.

title: Bookmark
description: I chose the simple deseign to practice and find new way of doing things in CSS or Javascript. Also, I thought it was a nice project to start practicing Typescript.

title: Multistep form
description: I choose theis project from frontendmentor.io because I wanted to build a multistep form as I didn't have chance before.
